sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词含有"伸展，延长"或"延伸"之意。
means: extend ： 指时间或空间的延长，也可指影响和使用范围等的扩大。
lengthen ： 指把长度或期限拉长或延长，其反义是shorten。
stretch ： 指长度的延伸以及宽度的增加。
prolong ： 通常指时间上延长得超过了一般或正常的限度。

sentence.Network_en: The new territory would extend over one-fifth of Canada's land mass.
sentence.Network_cn: 这块新领土将会使加拿大陆地面积扩展1/5以上。

sentence.Network_en: This year they have introduced three new products to extend their range.
sentence.Network_cn: 今年他们发布了3种新产品，以扩大产品范围。

sentence.Network_en: It might be possible to extend the technique to other crop plants.
sentence.Network_cn: 也许可以将这种技术应用于其他农作物。

给予;捐赠;分配
其他释义
延长;扩大;伸出
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin extendere 'stretch out', from ex- 'out' + tendere 'stretch'

entry.def: If you say that something, usually something large, extends for a particular distance or extends from one place to another, you are indicating its size or position.

example.ex: The caves extend for some 18 kilometres...
The main stem will extend to around 12ft, if left to develop naturally...
example.tran: 如果任其自然生长，主干可以长到约12英尺。

entry.def: If an object extends from a surface or place, it sticks out from it.

example.ex: A shelf of land extended from the escarpment.

entry.def: If an event or activity extends over a period of time, it continues for that time.

example.ex: ...a playing career in first-class cricket that extended from 1894 to 1920...
example.tran: 从1894年延续至1920年的板球甲级比赛职业生涯

example.ex: The courses are based on a weekly two-hour class, extending over a period of 25 weeks.
example.tran: 这些课程每周上一节课，每节两个小时，持续25周。

entry.def: If something extends to a group of people, things, or activities, it includes or affects them.

example.ex: The service also extends to wrapping and delivering gifts...
example.tran: 服务项目还包括包装和递送礼物。

example.ex: The talks will extend to the church, human rights groups and other social organizations...
example.tran: 会谈将涉及教会、人权团体和其他社会组织。

entry.def: If you extend something, you make it longer or bigger.

example.ex: This year they have introduced three new products to extend their range...
example.tran: 今年他们发布了3种新产品，以扩大产品范围。

entry.def: If a piece of equipment or furniture extends, its length can be increased.

example.ex: ... a table which extends to accommodate extra guests...
example.tran: 展开后可坐更多客人的桌子

entry.def: If you extend something, you make it last longer than before or end at a later date.

example.ex: They have extended the deadline by twenty-four hours.
example.tran: 他们已经将最后期限延长了24小时。

entry.def: If you extend something to other people or things, you make it include or affect more people or things.

example.ex: It might be possible to extend the technique to other crop plants.
example.tran: 也许可以将这种技术应用于其他农作物。

entry.def: If someone extends their hand, they stretch out their arm and hand to shake hands with someone.

example.ex: The man extended his hand: 'I'm Chuck'.
example.tran: 那名男子伸出手说道：“我是查克。”

means.word_mean: 1. extend in scope or range or area;

sentences.sentence: "The law was extended to all citizens"

means.word_mean: 2. stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope; run or extend between two points or beyond a certain point;

sentences.sentence: "Service runs all the way to Cranbury"
"My memory extends back to my fourth year of life"
"The facts extend beyond a consideration of her personal assets"

means.word_mean: 3. span an interval of distance, space or time;

sentences.sentence: "The period covered the turn of the century"
"My land extends over the hills on the horizon"

means.word_mean: 4. make available; provide;

sentences.sentence: "The bank offers a good deal on new mortgages"

means.word_mean: 5. thrust or extend out;
6. reach outward in space;

sentences.sentence: "The awning extends several feet over the sidewalk"

means.word_mean: 7. offer verbally;
8. extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body;

sentences.sentence: "Extend your right arm above your head"

means.word_mean: 9. expand the influence of;

sentences.sentence: "The King extended his rule to the Eastern part of the continent"

means.word_mean: 10. lengthen in time; cause to be or last longer;

sentences.sentence: "She extended her visit by another day"
"The meeting was drawn out until midnight"

means.word_mean: 11. extend or stretch out to a greater or the full length;
12. cause to move at full gallop;

sentences.sentence: "Did you gallop the horse just now?"

means.word_mean: 13. open or straighten out; unbend;

sentences.sentence: "Can we extend the legs of this dining table?"

means.word_mean: 14. use to the utmost; exert vigorously or to full capacity;

sentences.sentence: "He really extended himself when he climbed Kilimanjaro"

means.word_mean: 15. prolong the time allowed for payment of;
16. continue or extend;

sentences.sentence: "The civil war carried into the neighboring province"
"The disease extended into the remote mountain provinces"

means.word_mean: 17. increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance;

sentences.sentence: "stretch the soup by adding some more cream"
"extend the casserole with a little rice"

auth_sentence.content: He's clearly trying to extend his audience reach.
auth_sentence.res_content: He's clearly trying to extend his audience reach.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He's clearly trying to extend his audience reach.

auth_sentence.content: This programmable world will extend beyond the physical city.
auth_sentence.res_content: This programmable world will extend beyond the physical city.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This programmable world will extend beyond the physical city.

auth_sentence.content: The goals in making these predictions extend beyond Sunday.
auth_sentence.res_content: The goals in making these predictions extend beyond Sunday.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The goals in making these predictions extend beyond Sunday.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图

stems_affixes.value_cn: 嫩的, 温柔的, 软弱的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向+er→像伸出的幼芽→嫩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
stems_affixes.word_buile: attend[v.出席,参加]+ance表名词→n.出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
attend[v.出席,参加]+ant人→n.服务员;随从,随员
intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图
tend趋向+ency表名词→n.趋势,趋向;倾向
at加强+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→出席
con一起+tend伸展,趋向→一起伸展→竞争,斗争

stems_affixes.value_cn: 延长,延伸;扩充;给予;提供;估价
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→扩张
in内+tend伸展,趋向→内心伸出→想要

stems_affixes.value_cn: 假装,假托,借口,[在演戏中]装扮
stems_affixes.word_buile: pre预先,提前+tend伸展,趋向→提前展开,事先展开→假装,借口
pro前+tend伸展,趋向→v.[使]伸出, [使]伸展

stems_affixes.value_cn: 趋向,往往是;易于,往往会;照料,看护
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向→趋向做→易于,往往会

Sentence.sentence: But they have a powerful hold on many people nonetheless, a hold extending far beyond their literary content.
Mothers are far more likely than fathers to take advantage of this law,But extended leaves and part-time employment are known to be harmful to careers—for both genders.
The central issue in the case is whether patent rights to living things extend to the progeny of those things.
Monsanto argues that its patents extend to later generations

means.word_mean: 延长; 扩展; 达到(某一点)

sentences.en: France has greatly extended its influence in world affairs.
sentences.cn: 在世界事务中, 法国的影响已大大地扩大了。

means.word_mean: 尽可能地伸开(身体某部)

sentences.en: He extended his hand in greeting.

means.word_mean: 给予, 提供, 发出

sentences.en: The bank will extend you credit.
sentences.cn: 银行会给你提供信用贷款。

sentences.en: It was kind of you to extend an invitation to us.

means.word_mean: (空间、时间等)延伸; 延续

sentences.en: My garden extends as far as the river.
sentences.cn: 我的花园一直伸展到河边。

means.word_mean: 伸，伸展，展现，伸直；扩展；扩充；连绵

sentences.en: The plateau extends for many miles.

means.word_mean: (在长度、面积、范围等方面)增加，增大，扩大；变长

sentences.en: The country's trade extended from China to Europe.
sentences.cn: 该国的贸易从中国扩大到了欧洲。

jushi.english: A belt of rain extends across the mountains.
jushi.chinese: 这一降雨带覆盖了此山脉。

jushi.english: China has greatly extended its influence in world affairs.
jushi.chinese: 在世界事务中,中国的影响已大大地扩大了。

jushi.english: Life expectancy has been greatly extended.
jushi.chinese: 平均寿命大大地延长了。
